data.reason: Updated workflow state labels for clarity: 'Needs Content' → 'Needs review (content)', 'Needs Review' → 'Needs review (code)', 'Needs Approval' → 'Needs approval'. Changed in both app.js formatRequires() function and index.html dropdown options.
data.title: tickboard workflow states

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:37 - Completed workflow label changes. Updated formatRequires() in app.js and dropdown in index.html. The test failures in the test run were pre-existing and unrelated to this change (missing ColumnBacklog/ColumnInput/ColumnReview constants and cloud client config issues).
data.title: tickboard workflow states

data.reason: Added secondary sort by tick ID in app.js to ensure stable ordering when priorities are equal. The issue was that LoadTicksParallel loads ticks concurrently with non-deterministic order, and the frontend sort only used priority which caused reordering for ticks with same priority.
data.title: tick board: explore spontaneous reordering

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:39 - Fixed by adding secondary sort by tick ID in app.js renderTicks(). Root cause: LoadTicksParallel uses concurrent goroutines with non-deterministic completion order, and frontend only sorted by priority. Now sorts by priority first, then by ID for ties. Commit: 935953f
data.title: tick board: explore spontaneous reordering

data.reason: Created DOMAIN_SETUP.md with comprehensive instructions for setting up custom domain (tickboard.io) for Cloudflare Worker. Updated wrangler.toml with commented route configuration. Actual domain registration and Cloudflare DNS setup requires manual action.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:41 - Created DOMAIN_SETUP.md with comprehensive instructions for setting up tickboard.io domain. The Go client already has DefaultCloudURL = wss://tickboard.io/agent, so once the domain is configured in Cloudflare, everything will work. Manual steps needed: 1) Register/purchase domain, 2) Add to Cloudflare, 3) Configure DNS records, 4) Uncomment routes in wrangler.toml, 5) Deploy. Consider using Cloudflare's 'Custom Domains' feature for simpler setup.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud

data.reason: Added DELETE /api/boards/:boardId endpoint with auth validation. Backend deleteBoard() in auth.ts performs SQL DELETE with user ownership check. Frontend adds remove button on board items (appears on hover, turns red) with confirmation dialog. Board list refreshes after removal. Non-destructive - boards can reconnect later.
data.title: Cloud: Allow removing boards from dashboard list

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:50 - Implemented board removal feature. Key points: (1) DELETE endpoint validates user ownership before deleting, (2) Removal is non-destructive - agents can reconnect and re-register the board, (3) UI shows remove button only on hover to avoid accidental clicks, (4) Confirmation dialog warns user that board can reconnect later.
data.title: Cloud: Allow removing boards from dashboard list

data.reason: Added dedicated 'Human-Only Tasks (awaiting=work)' section to tk top-level help with clear explanation and examples for creating/updating tasks with --awaiting work, how they're skipped by agent queues, and how to return them to agent queue
data.title: Document awaiting=work in tk top-level help

data.note: 2026-01-16 21:03 - Domain tickboard.dev is now live. Worker deployed with custom_domain feature which auto-manages DNS. Both tickboard.dev and www.tickboard.dev route to the worker. Updated ~/.tickboardrc locally to use new URL. Note: Some tests fail due to pre-existing issues (TestLoadConfig_NoToken doesn't account for existing config file, server tests reference undefined constants) - not caused by this change.

data.reason: Added viewport-fit=cover for notched devices, set base 16px font on html with text-size-adjust for iOS, added overflow-x:hidden to html/body/#app, added safe-area-inset support for header/toasts, added responsive header breakpoints at 768px/480px with flex-wrap and proper sizing
data.title: Add viewport meta and base responsive styles

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:17 - Completed [dye]: Added base responsive styles. Key changes: viewport-fit=cover for notched devices, overflow-x:hidden on html/body, safe-area-inset support via CSS env(), responsive header with flex-wrap at 768px/480px breakpoints. Existing 480px media query enhanced with touch target sizing (min 44px). Toast container now uses safe area insets. The search/filter inputs grow flexibly on mobile. Repo name hidden on very small screens to save space.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: Added responsive CSS for kanban board: (1) Mobile <480px: columns stack vertically with full width, max-height 300px per column with scroll, optimized touch targets; (2) Tablet 481-768px: horizontal scroll with fixed 260px columns, scroll-snap for smooth navigation; (3) Adjusted card/header sizing for each breakpoint
data.title: Responsive kanban board layout

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:20 - Completed [h81]: Responsive kanban layout implemented. Key breakpoints: (1) Mobile <480px stacks columns vertically with scrollable column content (max-height 300px), (2) Tablet 481-768px uses horizontal scroll with fixed 260px columns and scroll-snap. Used CSS-only approach - no JS changes needed. The :has() selector is used for empty column detection (modern browser support). Previous iteration's base responsive work (viewport-fit, safe-area-insets) was leveraged.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard
Kanban: sort done in order of when they were closed

data.reason: Added mobile touch interactions: (1) CSS @media (pointer: coarse) rules ensure 44px min touch targets for all interactive elements, (2) Touch-friendly drag-and-drop with long-press to initiate (300ms), visual ghost element, and drop zone indicators - supports moving cards to Done (close) or from Done (reopen), (3) Enhanced tablet swipe navigation with scroll-snap-type:x mandatory for smooth column swiping. Key files: style.css (touch target CSS, drag/drop styles), app.js (touch event handlers, drag state management).
data.title: Mobile touch interactions

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:22 - Completed [rgd]: Added mobile touch interactions. Key implementation details: (1) Touch targets use @media (pointer: coarse) to apply 44px minimum sizing only on touch devices - keeps desktop UI unchanged. (2) Drag-and-drop uses long-press (300ms) to differentiate from scroll gestures - the startTouchDrag function creates a ghost element and placeholder. (3) Only Done column transitions are supported via drag (close/reopen) since other columns are determined by tick properties not direct moves. (4) Swipe navigation relies on CSS scroll-snap-type:x mandatory - browser handles the physics. (5) The touch drag handlers are re-attached when cards re-render via renderTicks override pattern.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: Added mobile hamburger menu with collapsible sidebar navigation. Implemented: (1) Hamburger toggle button visible at 768px breakpoint using CSS-only animated icon, (2) Left-sliding navigation drawer with epic filter dropdown, search input, create tick button, and switch board button for cloud mode, (3) Keyboard shortcut help button in footer, (4) Full sync between mobile and desktop filters, (5) Escape key closes nav, overlay click closes nav, (6) Touch-friendly 44px minimum touch targets. Files modified: index.html, style.css, app.js
data.title: Mobile navigation and header

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:26 - Completed [g7c]: Mobile navigation implemented. Key details: (1) Hamburger menu appears at 768px breakpoint via CSS media query - no JS needed for show/hide toggle button. (2) Mobile nav sidebar is 280px wide (max 85vw) with slide-in animation. (3) Mobile filter changes sync to desktop filters and vice-versa. (4) Search in mobile nav is live-updating (no close on type). Epic filter closes nav after selection for better UX. (5) z-index hierarchy: nav overlay 180, nav sidebar 190, modals 200+. (6) The header-center (search/filter) is hidden on mobile since it's in the sidebar.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: Implemented mobile column tabs UI for switching between columns instead of vertical stacking. Added tab bar with column icons, labels, and counts that appears at <480px breakpoint. Only one column is visible at a time, with full-screen height for card scrolling. Tabs are color-coded per column type and show real-time counts.
data.title: Responsive kanban board layout

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:29 - Completed [h81] (revisited): Replaced vertical column stacking with mobile column tabs. Human feedback suggested tabs would be better UX than vertical stacking. Key implementation: tab bar with 5 column buttons at <480px, CSS-only column show/hide via .mobile-active class, JS handles tab switching and maintains state. Tabs show icons, short labels, and live counts. Color-coded per column type. Desktop unchanged - tabs hidden via display:none on larger screens.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: Created PWA icons (192x192, 512x512 + maskable variants), Apple touch icon (180x180), favicon set (16x16, 32x32 PNG + ICO). Added manifest.json with proper icon references. Updated index.html with favicon links, apple-touch-icon, manifest link, theme-color meta, and Apple PWA meta tags.
data.title: Generate app icons for PWA

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:33 - Completed [cfy]: Generated PWA icons and favicon set. Key implementation: (1) Icons generated using sharp-cli via npx for SVG-to-PNG conversion. (2) favicon.ico created with Node.js script embedding PNG data (ICO format). (3) All icons use Catppuccin Mocha colors (#1e1e2e background, #f5e0dc checkmark). (4) Maskable icons have smaller checkmark to fit within 80% safe zone. (5) manifest.json created with standard + maskable purpose icons. (6) index.html updated with full favicon stack, Apple PWA meta tags, and theme-color. Files: icon-192.png, icon-512.png, icon-maskable-192.png, icon-maskable-512.png, apple-touch-icon.png, favicon-16x16.png, favicon-32x32.png, favicon.ico, manifest.json, icon.svg, icon-maskable.svg.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: Added service worker (sw.js) with cache-first strategy for static assets and network-first for API calls. Service worker registration added to index.html. Fixed manifest.json icon paths to use absolute URLs. PWA now supports offline caching of static files.
data.title: Add PWA manifest and service worker

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:36 - Completed [vxc]: Added service worker for PWA offline support. Key implementation: (1) sw.js uses cache-first strategy for static assets (/static/*) with stale-while-revalidate pattern - returns cached response immediately but fetches update in background. (2) API calls skip service worker entirely to always hit network. (3) WebSocket and SSE connections are excluded from caching. (4) Fixed manifest.json icon paths to use absolute URLs (/static/...) for proper resolution. (5) Service worker registration in index.html happens on 'load' event. Cache version is 'tickboard-v1' - increment when deploying breaking changes.
data.title: Mobile & Responsive Tickboard

data.reason: all tasks completed

data.note: 2026-01-16 22:39 - Done column now sorts by closed_at descending (most recently closed on top). Changed renderTicks() in app.js to separate done ticks from others and apply different sorting logic.

data.reason: Created cmd/tk/cmd/ package with Cobra root.go (root command, version info, SetVersion) and version.go subcommand. Updated main.go to import cmd package and sync version. Existing functionality preserved.
data.title: Set up Cobra root command and cmd structure

data.note: 2026-01-17 22:39 - Iteration 1 complete: Created cmd/tk/cmd/ package with Cobra structure. Key files: root.go (rootCmd with SetVersion), version.go (example subcommand). main.go imports cmd package and syncs version in init(). Future tasks should add commands by creating new files in cmd/tk/cmd/ with init() functions that call rootCmd.AddCommand(). Note: TestRejectCommand was already failing before this work (pre-existing issue).
data.title: Phase 0: CLI Foundation (Cobra migration)

data.reason: Ported init and whoami commands to Cobra. Created cmd/tk/cmd/init.go with --import-beads flag and cmd/tk/cmd/whoami.go with --json flag. Added ExecuteArgs() to root.go for routing from main.go. Updated main.go import alias to cobracmd to avoid variable shadowing. Removed old runInit and runWhoami functions from main.go.
data.title: Port init and whoami commands to Cobra

data.note: 2026-01-17 22:44 - Iteration 2 complete: Ported init and whoami commands to Cobra. Created init.go with --import-beads flag and whoami.go with --json flag. Added ExecuteArgs() to root.go to pass args from main.go's run() function. Used 'cobracmd' import alias in main.go to avoid shadowing the local 'cmd := args[1]' variable. Pattern: new Cobra commands go in cmd/tk/cmd/*.go, add to switch in main.go's run() with cobracmd.ExecuteArgs(args[1:]).
data.title: Phase 0: CLI Foundation (Cobra migration)

data.reason: Created cmd/tk/cmd/show.go with Cobra showCmd using --json flag. Added 'show' to Cobra routing in main.go switch statement. Removed old runShow function from main.go. Used time.Time instead of *time.Time for formatTime helper.
data.title: Port show command to Cobra
